text:
Not necessarily wars. Conflicts that deeply antagonise groups of people. Not all of them lead to open wars. For example in South Africa the fault line shifted from race to wealth distribution* without a major armed conflict. 

* I should have used this term instead of „Greed”

text: #SouthAfrica is the richest nation in Africa yet more than half of its citzens live below the national povery line. Estimates put South Africa as the most unequal society in the world. Fair Wealth distribution is priority for the security, growth and welfare of all its citizens.
text_html: #SouthAfrica is the richest nation in Africa yet more than half of its citzens live below the national povery line. Estimates put South Africa as the most unequal society in the world. Fair Wealth distribution is priority for the security, growth and welfare of all its citizens.

text:
"We know what's need to be done to grow our economy"

Wealth distribution is skewed in South Africa. Any economic growth benefits SA companies (who never invest back in the economy instead they prefer tax havens) & minorities.

We're the world's most unequal society by design.

Gini is just a measure. One can construct a Gini of the income distribution, the wealth distribution, or of other things.

text:
It's not a hierarchy as much as it is inequality, Nick.

Economic structures with skewed wealth distribution exist globally, it's at the highest levels in South Africa.

Resigning it to being "inevitable" leads to lazy policy making, poor incentives & a widening gap of inequality
text_html: It's not a hierarchy as much as it is inequality, Nick. Economic structures with skewed wealth distribution exist globally, it's at the highest levels in South Africa. Resigning it to being "inevitable" leads to lazy policy making, poor incentives & a widening gap of inequality
